definition: to fall and smash into pieces
to throw down/to fall/to drop and break
broken/damaged/worn out/lousy/rotten/to break, split or cleave/to get rid of/to destroy/to break with/to defeat/to capture (a city etc)/to expose the truth of

sentences.english: The outer rind is so thick and tough that from whatever height it may fall it is never broken.
sentences.chinese: 它的外壳是那样硬，从多高的树上掉下来都不会摔破。

sentences.english: In his fury he threw the vase upon the ground so (that) they were broken.
sentences.chinese: 他盛怒之下，便把花瓶扔到地上，摔破了。

sentences.english: Break the rules of photography knowingly, but not your camera.
sentences.chinese: 打破常规摄影法则，但别摔破你的相机。

sentences.english: The cup was not broken at all when dropped.
sentences.chinese: 这只杯子掉到地上时居然没摔破。

sentences.english: If you are not careful, you will drop the eggs.
sentences.chinese: 如果你不小心点，你会把蛋摔破。

sentences.english: Could you take care this bag by yourself, sir? I'm afraid the contents might break.
sentences.chinese: 您能提着这个包吗，先生？我怕里面的东西会摔破。

sentences.english: On entering the door I remembered the doll I had broken.
sentences.chinese: 一进门我就记起了那个被我摔破的娃娃。

sentences.english: In his fury he threw the stone tablets upon the ground so that they were broken.
sentences.chinese: 他大怒之下，便把那些石匾扔到地上，摔破了。

sentences.english: About half an hour ago I fell on the ground and hurt my leg. It bled a lot.
sentences.chinese: 大约半小时前，我摔倒在地，把腿摔破了流了很多血。
